title: Bengaluru: Two male BPO employees and their driver allegedly stripped, sexually assaulted
text:
Representational Image On Wednesday, reports of two male BPO employees and their driver being allegedly stripped ad sexually assaulted came to light. This comes just days after the gang-rape of a female call centre employee in a tempo traveller in the city.
According to a report in The New Indian Express, the incident took place on September 30 when they two employees were heading back home in a tempo traveller. The vehicle apparently got into a small accident and an argument followed between the car driver and their driver.
The car driver is said to have asked for money and when the driver refused they assaulted him. It was then that the two BPO employees came to help him. The three of them were taken to an isolated location and then allegedly sexually assaulted by people in the other vehicle, according to the report.
The report adds that the police have arrested three people in connection with this incident. The culprit reportedly took ATM cards, mobile phones and Rs 600 from the three men.
The victims have filed a case with the Mico Layout Police. Investigations are on, report the police.
